name: Lilongwe Wildlife Centre
description: Malawi's only wildlife sanctuary, rescuing and rehabilitating wild animals, promoting conservation and environmental education.

name: Old Town Market (Lilongwe)
description: A bustling hub of local commerce, offering fresh produce, crafts, and a vibrant cultural experience.

name: Kamuzu Palace
description: The official residence of the President of Malawi, an impressive architectural landmark.

name: Lake Malawi National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its unique cichlid fish, clear waters, and stunning sunsets.

name: Liwonde National Park
description: Malawi's premier wildlife viewing destination, home to elephants, rhinos, lions, and diverse birdlife.

name: Chilobwe Cultural Village
description: Experience traditional Malawian village life, crafts, music, and dance demonstrations.

name: Kumbali Cultural Village
description: A rural lodge offering insights into Malawian culture, traditional dances, and farming practices.

name: Nkhotakota Wildlife Reserve
description: Malawi's oldest and largest wildlife reserve, recently restocked with diverse animal species.
